Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adler J. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adler J. Hill in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Adler J. Hill in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF211, 15CF213 and 16CF220.   15CF211 is set for sentencing after revocation.  15CF213 def entered plea.  16CF220  DRI Ct 1 and plea to Ct 2.  Probation 2 yrs to run concurrent.  Conditions stated by Atty Constable.  Recess 2:15 pm  Reconvene 2:29 pm  All parties present.  DA has reviewed revocation packet.  State will go along with agents recommendations.  Atty Abernethy-Mays will argue sentence.  Joint agreement on 15CF213 & 16CF220.  Court will proceed on these cases.  Plea advisement form completed and reviewed.  16CF220 - Ct 2 - No contest plea entered.  Ct 1 DRI consistent with plea agreement.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Plea entered freely & voluntarily.  Complaints reviewed, factual basis.  Court finds def. understand charges, penalties and rights.  Plea accepted.  Found guilty Ct2 16CF220. 15CF213 Ct 1.  Revocation packet received and reviewed.  No corrections.  State presents sentencing arguments.  15CF211 State is requesting 9 months jail, consecutive.   Credit of 133 days.  16CF220 & 15CF213 2 years probation concurrent, consecutive to 15CF211.   Victim rights have been complied with for all cases.  Atty Abernethy-Mays presents arguments for sentencing.  Requesting 6 months jail on 15CF211.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  Court will accept plea agreement on 15CF213 & 16CF220.  15CF213 Sentence withheld 2 yr probation.  Cost  Plus DNA surcharge.  Sample already given.  Counseling as deemed necessary.  Domestic abuse counseling.  Parenting classes.  16CF220 sentence withheld probation 2 yrs on Ct 2  same conditions.  Cost & DNA surcharge.    16CF220 - 7 days credit  & 15CF213 4 days credit if revoked.  15CF211 Court orders jail sentence will be consecutive.  Probation will commence after jail sentence.  Orders 8 months jail, credit 133 days.  Outstanding court obligations converted to civil judgment.  Huber privileges.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post convictions rights  Felony conviction rights reviewed.  Bond to be applied to 16CF220 1st then 15CF213.  Huber according to jail policies.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Revocation Packet Summary
Agreement for Modification to Condition of Probation
DNA Proof of Submission
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

Defendant Adler J. Hill in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF211 and 15CF213 @ 2:10 p.m. Agreement stated - 15CF211 - amended information filed, Def will plead to ct 1, dismiss and read in ct 2. Ct 1 - withheld sentence, 2yrs probation, AODA and follow through, sex offender assessment and follow through, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  15CF213 - amended information filed, Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss w/prejudice, ct 1 - defer judgment 2 yrs, written agreement prepared. State has complied with victim notification requirements. Atty Schuster agrees. Def agrees. Court reviews plea quest. 15CF211 Court grants amendment to ct 1 and in 15CF213 ct 1. 15CF211 ct 1 - no contest plea. 15CF213 ct 1 - no contest plea. 15CF211 ct 2 dismissed and read in. 15CF213 ct 2 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF211 ct 1 as amended and 15CF213 ct 1 as amended. Counsel heard on sentencing and deferred judgment agreement. Atty Schuster advises 7 days sentence credit and asks bond be returned to poster, will provide updated address to the Court. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will follow agreement. 15CF211 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, sex offender assessment and follow through, court costs, DNA surcharge, return bond to poster at updated address, credit for 7 days if revoked.  15CF213 - court approves deferred judgment agreement for 2 yrs. $500 signature bond.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 15CF211 - DNA sample. Postconviction rights.  8/9/18 @ 1:00 p.m. review hearing on 15CF213.
